page.title: 06TRANSPORT
page.content: 3 fee-paying car parks exist in the town.One other exists in Cantilupe Rd but is due to close later in l985 for the new library to be constructed. A survey showed l3 people would park in the car park,against 9 on the restric- ted road areas. 3 garages exist in the area; all carrying out servicing & sales,but only 2 offering petrol fac- ilities. Only one carries out agricul- tural repairs and sales.Road haulage is an important factor in Ross since it no longer has the railway to carry goods from the town. Littlewoods have 8-9 articulated lorries, all fitted with tacographs. The coal depot relies on lorries to collect up to 425 tons of coal from South Wales every two weeks, in 23 ton loads; this is then redistributed to local areas.
